ImageFactory Class Reference
[GUI]

#include <Apoxi/AddOns/MultiMedia/ImageFactory.hpp>


Static Public Member Functions

static Image * CreateImage (BinData *data, BOOLEAN *success=0)
static void DestroyImage (Image *image)
static INT GetImageId (const BinData &data)

Detailed Description

ImageFactory deleviers an image object or an image ID from a given binary data stream.

Member Function Documentation

Image * ImageFactory::CreateImage (  BinData *  data,
BOOLEAN *  success = 0
)  [static]
 

Creates the correct image object from a given binary data stream. The image object will obtain the bin data object and release when deleting the image object.

Parameters:
data Binary data stream which contains the image data.
success Optional output parameter, which is TRUE if the image object is valid

void ImageFactory::DestroyImage (  Image *  image  )  [static]
 

Deprecated - the method ImageFactory::CreateImage always uses 'new' for creating an instance, hence the instance can be deleted by invoking 'delete'. It is recommended to use an ImageObtainer as encapsulation for an image, as the image-obtainer automatically takes care about deleting the image if no applications refer to the image anymore.

INT ImageFactory::GetImageId (  const BinData &  data  )  [static]
 

Returns the image ID of the binary data stream. The bin data object is not obtained by the image factory and hence not released. It just acts as input parameter.
